name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Harbor Plaza and Conference Center

reviews.text: Enjoyed our stay there and would stay there again! I think it's the best deal in town. Was a convenient location to our son and his family. My grandchildren loved swimming in the pool and hot tub. Our room was very comfortable too.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable and Convenient location

reviews.text: A really great place and got a very good rate. The staff was very friendly. The breakfast is good and has a fairly large spread. There is an Asian restaurant right across from the reception. Rooms were clean and spacious.
reviews.title: Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the 2nd time we've stayed at this Best Western, and we were very pleased again with the accommodations, the staff and the breakfast. The staff are delightful - engaging and very helpful; we love the spacious rooms, as we can each spread out; the breakfast had variety and was tasty. Whidbey Island is a wonderful place to explore, and we find this hotel is in a good location for wherever we want to go on the Island. We'll be back!
reviews.title: Did not disappoint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A really great place at a really great rate. Good location, nice rooms, and free breakfast. And if it's a Best Western, I don't have to worry about what my accomodations will be like--they're always great!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: not as good as some other Best Westerns where we stayed.
reviews.title: another overnight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were impressed by the spacious rooms and comfortable beds and chairs of this chain hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable beds and rooms

reviews.text: The water pressure in the shower was good.
reviews.title: Wasn't Expecting That

reviews.text: The breakfast appeared to be well received although a little wider choice of cereal would have been welcome. No waffles or pancakes.
reviews.title: Centrally-located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is situated at the north end of the town and unfortunately appeared to be directly under the flight path for the naval aircraft that fly low over the Island both early and late. This may not be a regular occurrence and would be true of all the hotels on the area.
reviews.title: Oak Harbor

reviews.text: This could be a good stopover for anyone needing to be in the area.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: We were in Washington to visit a family member.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone at the Hotel was pleasant and friendly, from check in to check out. The breakfast was always hot, good choices. Clean . Room was perfect and clean.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice clean place to stay. The hotel has helpful staff and quiet rooms. I would stay here anytime I am on Whidbey Island. I would guess that any room is a good one. Parking is shared with a restaurant and can be scarce.
reviews.title: om the road

reviews.text: The hotel was very nice, check in was a little confusing as a new girl was on desk and she was not up to speed as to what we requested, but after a while we got that squared away. Room was very adaquate and clean and people were very helpful.
reviews.title: This is a very nice Best Western

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Best Western Plus Harbor Plaza and Conference Center was with a group that was touring the area. The front desk staff was always helpful and accommodating. The rooms were large and very clean with daily service. The location is right off the main highway and nearby restaurants and stores. There was a continental breakfast and the service was very good. And also there were delicious cookies every afternoon.
reviews.title: A Must stay while in Oak Harbor

reviews.text: This was a typical experience from a chain hotel. The room the clean, the staff was friendly. The only thing that stood out was the free breakfast - a much bigger selection than I had anticipated. Not a bad place to have a short stay.
reviews.title: Typical chain hotel
Beyond Disappointed
reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. Minimal room and amenities, clunky elevator, used wet towel hanging behind the bathroom door, faucet leaked all over the counter, open bathroom design made it uncomfortable for sitting and watching tv, and if one person gets up early and the other sleeps in, there is too much noise and light. Turned on the heater in the morning and choked on the fowl smell. Breakfast was alright but I suppose we are spoiled by Hampton Inn. Front desk staff was efficient but unresponsive to complaints. Breakfast staff was heard carrying on loud personal conversations and seen standing and watching tv.

The hubby, and I decided last minute to stay at this hotel while up visiting some out of town family. The front desk was helpful, and had us booked in a jiff. I mentioned that I would love an early check in, and he suggested that I try calling around 1pm on day of check in, and they may have something available. I did just that. I called at 1pm when we made it to town, and they had our room ready. Check in was fast, and easy. We hadn't even made it all the way in our room before we heard the room's phone ring, and my hubby ran to pick it up. It was the front desk, and they said they had noticed us walking in with an infant, and asked if we were in need of a crib! WHAT?! We have stayed in hotels/motels all over the US, and have always had to plead for our crib to be delivered before bed time, so we were shocked that before we even had time to kick off our shoes, we already had our youngest's bed delivered, and ready for her. After that we suited up, and headed to the "heated pool". Well the pool isn't very warm at all. We lasted in the frigid water all of 30 minutes, before we called it quits due to blue lips, and goose pimples. I do suggest maybe a warning as to the pools temp, or something of that nature. We got the kids all excited to go swimming, and it was a bit of a bust. The room was clean, and it came with a DVD player (that is pretty rare). Your morning shower is sure to wake you up with it's fire hose like pressure (the hubby loved it). The breakfast was great…kiddos love picking out all the different things they want to eat. Check out was quick, and painless. All in all, a great, quick stay! We will totally be back later in the summer, when the pool is actually warm :)
reviews.title: Great weekend get away!

reviews.text: I like the area and looks of your hotel. I would suggest a microwave in the breakfast room to heat muffins, etc. I used your hotel as base while I was there buying a house. Good place for meetings, etc.
reviews.title: My Stay

reviews.text: This is one of the nicer best westerns in my opinion. The hotel is coveniently located off the main road and there are many restaurants in walking distance.
reviews.title: Good choice while visiting whidbey

aka: Best Western Harbor Hotel Oak Harbor
description: Oak Harbor - Whidbey Island Located 1 mile from NAS Whidbey Island, Base 6 miles from deseption pass bridge. AAA 3 diamond hotel with Mitzels restaurant and lounge located on the property. King and queen beds available. Go whale watching or sit on one of the many beaches located on the north end of Whidbey Island. Rates vary due to seasonal changes.
